item.title: Open-World Games That Get Darker Along The Way
item.description:
Summary

  • Open-world games can start relaxing but quickly turn dark, luring players into nightmares.
  • Valheim tricks players with relaxing gameplay before surprising with powerful enemies.
  • Elden Ring offers beauty at the start, but deeper areas hold dark and unnerving challenges.

Open-world games are among the best options for players who want to see how they would behave in a fantasy or sci-fi setting. They're also one of the best possible picks when players want a game that will help them relax — for the most part.

It turns out there are many open-world games that start off rather plainly — or even colorfully — only to then force players into an unrelenting descent into the depths of hell. Here's a look at the open world games that do the best job at luring players into worlds that hide increasingly dark nightmares.

Dredge

A Spectacular Descent Into A Lovecraftian World

4 Images
4 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Follow
Followed
Dredge
Adventure
Systems
10
8.2 /10
Released
March 31, 2023
ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Animated Blood, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Use of Tobacco
Developer(s)
Black Salt Games
Publisher(s)
Team17

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

There are few cozier pastimes than fishing. Dredge knows this, so it invites players to a game that will, supposedly, be all about fishing and acquiring treasure. That's nice, at least up until nightfall, when the game begins to get all kinds of creepy. Luckily, things do go back to being nice when daytime returns — or do they?

The truth is, they don't. The days start to get creepy as players progress through the campaign, and the nights, unsurprisingly, do so as well. Ultimately, Dredge provides a steep descent into the same nightmares contained in the stories of H.P. Lovecracft, and it works even better when players fall into the trap, mostly unaware of it all.

Valheim

It's All Fun And Games Until The Deathsquito Arrives

Valheim
8.7 /10
Released
February 2, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
r
Powered by

Valheim is a unique open-world survival game, because it's pretty relaxing for the most part. Sure, there are the eventual semi-coordinated attacks by random animals, but surviving in this game is pretty easy — maybe because players embody a true Viking.

That's great, but the game also uses this aspect as a clever trap. When players finally decide they need to find new land, they might come upon even more beautiful lands, which do a great job of drawing the attention away from cute-looking enemies that are actually much more powerful. These creatures can outdo a party of burly Valhalla-ready men in a few seconds.

The Witcher 3: Blood And Wine DLC

A Vacation Gone Wrong

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
55
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Powered by

While the same also applies to the main game, which begins in a beautiful swampland and culminates in a battle against the ice apocalypse, it's even more true regarding The Witcher 3's superb DLC, Blood and Wine. This side story brings Geralt to a beautiful region inspired by the real-life South of France, and players can't be blamed for seeing it as a nice little vacation.

Everything is beautiful here, and there's also wine (or vineyards, at least) everywhere. Even Geralt gets his own vineyard! Unfortunately, however, regardless of the players' decisions throughout the DLC, it will all culminate in the biggest figurative — and literal — bloodbaths in gaming.

Pacific Drive

Drive For Your Life

The word "pacific" means "peaceful," and that's exactly what Pacific Drive is, at least for a while. The game tasks players with getting in their tooled-up car to navigate a peculiar pre- or post-apocalypse landscape, and it's pretty nice most of the time.

A game where players get to drive will always provide a nice amount of relaxation, but Pacific Drive will eventually steer players into the realm of pure horror. On top of it being a welcome change of pace, it gains the game extra points for adding bizarre horror elements that feel incredibly original in today's stagnated horror landscape.

Red Dead Redemption 2

Outlaws To The Bitter End

Your comment has not been saved

Follow
Followed
Red Dead Redemption 2
Action
Adventure

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

Anyone who's played the original Red Dead Redemption will venture into Red Dead Redemption 2, its prequel, with the burden of knowing things will not turn out for the best for everyone involved. RDR2 sold way more copies than the original title, meaning that, even though fans were likely ready for more heartbreak, most players weren't.

That's especially tough because of how cool and friendly everyone in the gang is (except for Micah, of course). Rockstar's devs knew RDR2 would hit players in the gut, and still pulled out all the stops so it could hit them as hard as possible.

Pathologic 2

Yes, It Gets Even Darker

8 Images
8 Images
Pathologic 2
9.3 /10
Released
May 23, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood, Language, Partial Nudity, Violence
Powered by

Most games on this list start off nicely, then take a turn that takes players to uncomfortable places. Pathologic is never a bright or colorful game, but it's so beautiful and unique in its mood that it can't help but become comfy in a unique way. Spend enough time in this world, and it'll feel like a peculiar vacation spot away from the rest of the gaming world. Still, Pathologic 2 — which serves as a remake of the original — indulges in making things darker at every step, sometimes in ways that might feel indigestible for many players.

Elden Ring

The Lands Between Go Very Deep

6 Images
6 Images
Elden Ring
10 /10
69
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Both the Lands Between from the original Elden Ring and the Lands of Shadow from the Shadow Of The Erdtree DLC are places of extreme beauty. Players can venture wherever they want from the start of the game, but if they follow the route intended for newbies, they will have a surprisingly easy and enjoyable start to their adventure. The challenge level will gradually increase, but the game will stay as eye-catching as it comes.

That is, until players reach Caelid, an entire area of the map that has been consumed by a mysterious blight that left all of its inhabitants deeply affected. It's a place where all sorts of living beings will feel some degree of unease, and that's far from how bad it gets. When diving into the deeper areas of the game, players will find themselves inside two areas so aesthetically displeasing that they'll make players think of Caelid as if it were home.

item.title: GTA 6 Fans Make Incredibly Accurate Replica of Jason's House in Fortnite
item.description:
Fans of Grand Theft Auto 6 and Fortnite have shared an impressive recreation of Jason's house in the online game. The build is remarkably faithful to the GTA 6 home, and even includes one of the interior rooms.

While hype for GTA 6 is at an all-time high, using Fortnite 's available tools to recreate levels and iconic buildings like Peach's Castle has been popular for years. Since GTA 6 was delayed, fans have been building elements of the upcoming Rockstar Games release in other titles, including one that remade Jason's home in Far Cry 5 .

Fortnite and GTA 6 Mash Together in Impressive Build

Now, a pair of fans of both games have shared a version of Jason's home from GTA 6 that they built in Fortnite . On Reddit, user Warm_Water_6792 shared the impressive recreation they made with another user called ComfortableIron1736. A pair of images showcase the Fortnite version, and compare them side-by-side with GTA 6 's original version. The efforts are incredibly impressive, with only minor differences visible in the two versions of the exterior of the house. Even set props ar perfectly set up to emulate the original, from the retro car near the viewer's point of view, down to the foliage and satellite dish. Other than wear and tear on the house being more apparent in GTA 6 's version, it's hard to tell the difference between them.

The next shot shows a screenshot of the two interiors, with the only major differences being the absence of Lucia and Jason themselves. The arrangement of the room is spot-on in the Fortnite version, with just about everything in the GTA 6 version present, including the game controller on the table. There are some slight differences visible in this image, with props like the lamp being slightly different in design, and the image on the wall appearing a bit larger in the Fortnite version. Nonetheless, it's a remarkable effort, especially since so few images of Jason's home have been seen so far.

Fans in the comments have been very appreciative of the build, complimenting the creators. Many were shocked that it was possible to create something like this in Fortnite . Some wanted to visit it for themselves, and the OP shared its map. Players can check it out for themselves with the code 6954-3373-7481. It will be interesting to see if these fans come out with more GTA 6 builds in Fortnite , especially as more of the game is revealed in the months to come.

item.title: Grow a Garden Tips and Tricks
item.description:
Grow a Garden is a popular gardening sim on Roblox where you get to manage and decorate multiple gardens with crops and pets. In the beginning, with limited Sheckles and resources, the idea of becoming a quadrillionaire, or just a trillionaire, might feel way out of reach.

But it’s totally doable if you make the right moves. Earning big comes down to smart garden management and placing higher-value pets. If you’re wondering what beginner tips can help you get better at GaG Roblox, this guide has got you covered.

Daily Quests and Free Seed Pets

As a new player, the smartest thing to do is take on daily quests regularly to earn free seed packs . You’ll find them by talking to Eloise at the Gear Shop. She’ll hand out three quests at a time , including things like planting carrots, harvesting blueberries, or earning Sheckles. You’ll begin with just 20 Sheckles, enough to plant two carrots, and from there, you can start growing crops and stacking up cash as you complete tasks.

These normal seed packs can reward you with slightly more profitable seeds like Pumpkin, Pineapple, Dragon Fruit, Cactus, and Mango. Once you’ve saved up enough money by selling crops, go for a Common Egg (50,000 Sheckles each) and try hatching Golden Labs or Dogs; they can dig up free seeds for you, too. If you get a bunny, that’ll also help boost your carrot value early on. Later, you can aim for Red Fox, Snail, and even fruit-stealing pets.

Play with Friends for Sheckles Boost

Grow a Garden rewards you for playing with friends. For every friend on your server, you get a 10% Friends Boost, which adds up to your Sheckles earnings . So, if three friends are with you, that’s a 30% bonus when selling crops to Steven at the Sell Stuff stall.

It’s one of the easiest ways to increase your income at the start, so make sure your friends hop in. If public servers are packed, and you can’t invite anyone, you can create a free VIP private server and have up to four friends join for a 40% Sheckles bonus.

Participate in Weekly Event

Almost every seven days (usually on Saturdays), a new update drops with fresh weekly events or a continuation of the last one. These events let you finish various tasks to earn special event currency, which you can spend at the event shop.

For beginners, it’s a great chance to grab profitable seeds, pets, and gear to increase your Sheckles income or unlock themed cosmetics . Event packs like Summer Seed Packs, Ancient Seed Packs, or Zen Seed Packs often hand out more valuable crops without costing Sheckles. Some even sell for as much as top-tier Legendaries, Mythicals, or Prismatics, so try not to miss these events.

Join GaG Stock Discord

Sam’s Seed Shop refreshes every five minutes with a changing stock of crop seeds. Since not everything appears at once, some seeds can be tricky to catch if you’re offline.

If you’re trying to grab high-profit Prismatics like Beanstalk, Ember Lily, Burning Bud, Sugar Apple, or Giant Pinecone, it’s worth joining Grow a Garden’s official stock Discord channel. It pings you whenever new seeds hit the shop , so you can hop in at the right time and snag the best crops before they disappear.

Use Gear and Pets for Stacking Mutations

If you stack more than one on the same plant, crop mutations can raise a fruit's value from just a few thousand to millions or more. Since mutations only show up during weather events, and you need to be online to catch them, there are a few ways to speed things up.

You can craft or buy tools like the Lightning Rod, Star Caller, or Night Staff and set them to target specific crops in your garden. Pets like Dragonfly, T-Rex, and Kitsune also increase your chances of getting mutations, though these ones are harder to get. For starters, basic critters like Bees and Honey Bees from the Bee Egg, or creatures like the Sea Turtle, Toucan, Praying Mantis, and Scarlet Macaw can also be a good choice.

Hop in an Hour Before the Update

About an hour before the weekly event drops, admin abuse usually kicks off , where Jandel, the dev of Roblox GaG , starts triggering special mutation events. You’ll often see old favorites like Black Hole (Voidtouched 135x), Meteor Shower (Meteoric 125x), and Disco Event (Disco 125x), along with newer ones like Radioactive Carrot (Radioactive 80x) and Brains (Infected 75x).

During this time, both the Event and Sam Seed shops tend to restock , offering rare seeds, tools, and eggs. Even after the update goes live, these surprise events and boosts sometimes continue, making it the best time to jump in and enjoy this gardening sim.

Unlock More Pet Slots

Pets are super useful in this Roblox experience. Some, like the Mole, Pancake Mole, and Crab, can bring you free tools, sprinklers, and Sheckles, while others, like the Giant Ant, Red Giant Ant, Deer, and Spotted Deer, help by giving duplicate fruits when you harvest.

Initially, you can only place three pets on your farm to benefit from their passive effects. But if you want to progress quickly, you’ll need more animals roaming around. To unlock extra pet slots, you can either trade aged pets to the Egg Salesman or buy slots with Robux from the game shop.

Players can also unlock bonus egg slots from the Pet Egg Stall, while inventory space and cosmetic slots can be bought from the Game Shop.

Buy from Traveling Merchants

Finally, one of the most useful features in Grow a Garden is the Traveling Merchants’ rotation. They show up roughly every four hours near the crop stand, offering exclusive items from past events. Here’s a quick rundown of each merchant and what they sell:

Traveling Merchants

Stock

Sky Merchant

  • Star Caller
  • Night Staff
  • Mutation Spray Cloudtouched

Honey Merchant

  • Flower Seed Pack
  • Bee Egg
  • Honey Sprinkler
  • Honey Crafters Crate
  • Bee Crate

Mutation Spray Merchant

  • Mutation Spray Wet
  • Mutation Spray Windstruck
  • Mutation Spray Verdant

Summer Seed Merchant

  • Avocado
  • Banana
  • Bell Pepper
  • Cauliflower
  • Feijoa
  • Green Apple
  • Kiwi
  • Loquat
  • Pineapple
  • Pitcher Plant
  • Prickly Pear
  • Rafflesia

Gnome Merchant

  • Common Gnome Crate
  • Farmers Gnome Crate
  • Classic Gnome Crate
  • Iconic Gnome Crate

item.title: Drag x Drive: All Timed Trials (& How to Complete Them)
item.description:
While players will spend most of their time in Drag x Drive on the court, they will surely explore the park at some point and see what other activities the game has to offer. They will quickly notice the several clock symbols all around it and might feel compelled to investigate.

Each clock symbol in the park represents a timed trial. Gamers who want to put their Drag x Drive abilities to the test beyond competing with others should try out these challenges and see how they do. Timed challenges will test players on just about every maneuver and trick in the game, as they must ace them in order to be able to complete the challenges before time is up.

Drag x Drive Timed Trials, Explained

There are time trials all around the park in Drag x Drive , and players can take on the challenge to see if they're able to beat it and set their own park record. These challenges usually take between 10 to 20 seconds from start to finish so it's a fun way to pass the time and test player's ability to perform certain moves and tricks.

When players start a challenge, they can see how much time they have in order to successfully complete it. If they're able to do it within the target time, they will receive a trophy for their efforts . Additionally, they can set a park record if no one has done it as fast as they have at the park where they're playing.

Some challenge symbols are yellow. Gamers can attempt to complete these challenges to get a Park Ring. Accumulating three Park Rings will also grant them a helmet customization option.

Easy Difficulty Challenges in Drag x Drive

Sprint Challenge

Location: Between the two courts

Objective: Reach the goal under 08.00 seconds

To easily reach the goal within the time limit, gamers should consider setting their current Player Style to Guard, as it has the highest Quickness stat.

Pool Vert 1

Location: In front of the pool, behind the blue court

Objective: Reach all 5 goals within 18.00 seconds

Before starting this challenge, players might want to go in the pool and practice their halfpipes, as they must master this maneuver in order to touch the five goals within the time limit. In order to jump while doing a halfpipe, players will have to go at full speed as they touch the top of the ramp . They must continue to do this while aiming towards the next objective.

Cone Zone 1

Location: First challenge icon behind the cones beyond the red court

Objective: Reach all 9 objectives within 15.00 seconds and avoid the cones

Players must put their best evasive maneuvers to the test, as they must touch all the goals within a limit time while avoiding the cones that have been put in their way.

Spinboost Sprint

Location: By the pink ramps, beyond the blue court

Objective: Reach the 3 objectives within 15.00 seconds

Players will have to take the ramps to one side and then return to touch to the goal. Mastering the Ramp Air maneuver will make it much easier for players to complete this challenge. To perform a Ramp Air, players must rotate their tires in opposite directions while in the air . There are various ramps in this area that will help players get airtime and pull this off. Once they reach the ground, they will receive a helpful speed boost.

Pipe Vert

Location: By the purple ramp behind the blue court

Objective: Reach the goal within 18.00 seconds

Players have to touch several objectives and get to the goal by going up and down the ramp.

Medium Difficulty Challenges in Drag x Drive

Jump Rope

Location: By the rope behind the red court

Objective: Reach the 11 objectives within 15 seconds

Players must master the Bunny Hop jump in order to jump rope in Drag x Drive and reach the objectives in this challenge. To Bunny Hop, players have to brake each wheel and then perform a tilting maneuver on one hand by lifting the joycon and quickly cancel it out by lifting the other one .

Slalom

Location: On the other side of the blue ramps, beyond the blue court

Objective: Reach all 11 checkpoints within 20.00 seconds

The key mechanic that players must ace in order to complete this challenge within time limit is turning. Players should play a few matches with their friends or go around the park to train their turning skills. Once they're confident enough, they can try this challenge.

Pool Vert 2

Location: Next to the pool, behind the blue court

Objective: Reach all 8 goals within 20.00 seconds

Similarly to the first Pool Vert challenge, players will want to master the halfpipe maneuver and then try this challenge. While the first challenge had all its objectives in their air on only one side of the pool, this will require players to move from one side to the other and catch the objectives at the bottom of the pool as well.

Cone Zone 2

Location: Second challenge icon behind the cones beyond the red court

Objective: Reach all 11 objectives within 20.00 seconds and avoid the cones

This is a hardest version of the Cone Zone 1 challenge, but it works exactly the same way; players must touch all of the checkpoints but not the cones.

Parkour Sprint

Location: Beyond the blue court, between the jump ropes and the pink and blue ramps

Objective: Reach the goal within 20.00 seconds

Players will have to sprint through a track while avoiding two ropes and some dirt on the ground. The best way to reach the objective quickly is to select the Guard Player Style, time the character with the rope to avoid having to Bunny Hop, get off the track before reaching the dirt, and sprinting as fast as possible. When players reach the ramp, they should perform a Ramp Air to get a speed boost.

Hard Difficulty Challenges in Drag x Drive

Cone Zone 3

Location: Third challenge icon behind the cones beyond the blue court

Objective: Reach all 14 objectives within 18.00 seconds and avoid the cones

Yet again, players must touch all objectives all avoiding the cones put in their way.

Cone Zone (Random)

Location: Last challenge icon behind the cones beyond the blue court

Objective: Reach all 8 objectives within 11.00 seconds and avoid the cones

This is an even more complicated version of Cone Zone, and it's extremely difficult, as gamers only have 11 seconds to touch 8 objectives - that's below 2 seconds per objective.

Tilt & Run

Location: By the dirt tracks beyond the red court

Objective: Reach the goal within 8.50 seconds

To complete this challenge, players will have to master the Tilting maneuver. To tilt in Drag x Drive , players must brake with one hand and lift the other one - this will cause one of their wheels to go up in the air. If they do this while going at a high speed, they will be able to tilt while moving.

item.title: Last Epoch Making Big Improvement to Minions in Season 3
item.description:
Last Epoch has revealed that minions will get a change with the addition of the Assassinate mode. This feature will be available in the next season of Last Epoch , along with other features that the developers revealed in a post on the game's official forum.

Released in 2024, Last Epoch is an action RPG that combines time travel, dungeon crawling, extensive character customization options, and high replayability. Last Epoch offers five classes for players to choose from, and masteries to make their experience even more unique. The game also features a season system and is currently in its second season, Tombs of the Erased, which began on April 17 and introduced features including new zones and endgame bosses. The next Last Epoch season is coming in the next few days, and the developers shared important changes that are on the way to the game.

Last Epoch Reveals Assassinate Mode for Minions in Season 3

Last Epoch has revealed that minions will receive the Assassinate mode in Season 3. The post on the game's official forum explains that with this new mode, minions will focus on enemies from further away, targeting rarer enemies and bosses. Meanwhile, players will be able to switch to the familiar Protect mode, which prioritizes keeping Last Epoch minions close to the player. To know which mode is active, players should note which icon appears next to the minion's portrait: the two swords represent Assassinate mode, and the shield represents Protect mode. In addition to these changes, Eleventh Hour Games will make improvements to the minions' target prioritization, so they can continue attacking the same target instead of bouncing between enemies.

Along with enhancements to minion AI, Season 3 will bring improvements to multiple minions from Last Epoch 's Beastmaster, including the addition of new nodes for the Raptor, Scorpion, and Bear. Addressing a long-standing request from Last Epoch players, they will be able to equip cosmetics in Offline Mode. For the feature to work, all they need to do is play in either offline or online mode once and configure the cosmetics to play without internet access.

Last Epoch Season 3 will begin on Thursday, August 21, and simultaneously with the changes to minions and Offline Mode, the Merchants' Guild will receive two updates. One is a change to filters to make shopping easier, and the other is the addition of tokens for players to purchase items without paying favors or before unlocking the required rank. With these and other tweaks that the game will receive, the developers aim to enhance the experience of Last Epoch players.

Last Epoch combines time travel, exciting dungeon crawling, engrossing character customization and endless replayability to create an Action RPG for veterans and newcomers alike. Travel through the world of Eterra’s past and face dark empires, wrathful gods and untouched wilds – to find a way to save time itself from The Void.

Embark on your adventure as one of five powerful classes and, through your journey, ascend into a unique Mastery Class that unlocks more specialized abilities and build-options.
